result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron R Pates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work.
Contact the probation and parole office by 5:00 p.m. on July 13, 2022.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00 p.m. on July 13th, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs,  fees and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron R Pates in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron R Pates appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds remotely. 

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 152 DAYS the House of Correction with credit for 92 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on July 13th, 2022.
Complete 25 hours of community service.
Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on July 13th, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 
APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN.
NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 07-11-22.fp

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Aaron R Pates not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30. Plea/sentencing hearing is scheduled on July 11, 2022 at 9:00am.
Pre-trial conference on May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Aaron R Pates in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Aaron R Pates in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron R Pates appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/ live/ 4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Aaron R Pates not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/30/22 @ 1:30p
